data.title: Study with the West Ham United Foundation
data.meta_description: The University of East London runs two undergraduate courses with the West Ham United foundation.
data.text:
Study with the West Ham United Foundation

A collaborative partnership providing a unique degree programme in sport.

Hero Carousel

Our courses

BSc (Hons) Sports Coaching and Performance

Get closer to your desired career in sport and coaching through working with the Foundation as well as the West Ham United Academy. On this course, you will learn the principles underpinning high quality coaching and explore how to create an environment for high performance athletes to thrive.

Learn about BSc (Hons) Sports Coaching and Performance.

GUEST LECTURES FROM EXPERTS

Learn from staff and players from West Ham United, Academy and women's team, bring their expertise and first-hand experience in the industry.

PLACEMENTS

Further your work-based learning with placements with West Ham United and global partners - gaining vital experience for future employment.

DOUBLE THE WORLD-CLASS FACILITIES

Students will learn at both University of East London’s state-of-the-art SportsDock and West Ham United's training venues.

My degree provided me with a platform to broaden my understanding of the sports industry. It exposed me to various events and organisations such as Kick It Out, leading me to my role at Crystal Palace where I lead on an award-winning programme."

Aaron Johnson

Crystal Palace FC Divert Programme Lead, Youth Crime Intervention Specialist at Sutton Council

PLACEMENTS WITH WEST HAM UNITED FOUNDATION

Students on our courses run in collaboration with West Ham United Foundation benefit on their vast network of projects and partner organisations. Students will take part in placements and collaborations meaning they graduate with a CV full of experience. This includes local primary and secondary schools as well as projects like Show Racism The Red Card.

West Ham United Foundation

West Ham United Foundation’s goals are to understand and meet the needs of the community and create an environment where all can thrive - from the heart of east London.

The Foundation uses a multi-layered and innovative approach to do this, centred around building partnerships and utilising insight and technology. In practice this may look like health initiatives helping those most vulnerable; providing mentoring, education and employment opportunities; keeping children and youths engaged and supported through sports and classroom provision; or giving people the opportunity to follow their football dreams on the pitch whilst gaining qualifications.

Over the last few years, the Foundation has grown vastly, engaging with up to 50,000 people annually and working with colleagues from across the football sector to ensure the delivery of the best Football Club Community Schemes.

On my degree with UEL and West Ham United Foundation, I was given so many opportunities and insights that I wouldn’t have gotten elsewhere. Getting the opportunity to see what the sports industry looks like and hearing from experts each week was priceless. I think my highlight was the work experience and placements, without them I wouldn’t be in my current role working in sport."

Mo Ali

Second Year Student
